item.description: The facility where detained Venezuelan President Nicolás Maduro has been taken is a notorious New York jail that has held a string of high-profile and celebrity criminals, from drug cartel leaders to hip-hop stars.

item.description: Mackay's chief medical officer, Charles Pain, returns to work after an external investigation cleared him of allegations of poor clinical governance.

item.description: Former Liberal staffer Bruce Lehrmann takes his appeal to the High Court against the findings that he, on the balance of probabilities, raped Brittany Higgins in 2019.

item.description: A young couple got bogged on a remote dirt road in north Queensland and was forced to walk hours in search of help after trusting their navigation app to find a 24-hour fuel station.

item.title: Queensland's far north-east braces for a deluge of rain and possible cyclone
item.description: A tropical low has been declared over the Coral Sea and it is expected to move towards the Far North Queensland coast over the next few days. The bureau said there is a moderate chance it could develop into a tropical cyclone.

item.title: Brisbane tug of war team relying on strength and strategy to keep ancient sport alive
item.description: The ancient sport of tug of war is being kept alive in Brisbane by an enthusiastic team, and some are calling for it to return to the Olympics.

item.title: Two-time major winner Coco Gauff heaps praise on rising Australian star Maya Joint
item.description: World number four Coco Gauff describes Maya Joint as a "great talent" ahead of a potential match-up against the 19-year-old Australian at the United Cup.

item.title: RBA deputy governor speaks exclusively to ABC News — as it happened

item.title: NT rangers capture croc a day in first week of new year, after more than 240 caught in 2025
item.description: Rangers in the Northern Territory have caught an average of a crocodile per day in the first week of 2026, including one measuring 4.9 metres pulled from waters near a popular swimming spot.

item.title: Australia's Emerson Jones targeting rankings jump in 2026 after Brisbane International showing
item.description: Emerson Jones gave a glimpse of her potential at the Brisbane International, with her 2026 season getting underway in promising fashion.

item.description: Americans are posting sunny social media dispatches about their new lives in Australia, but there is something more revealing underneath.

item.description: Australian names are among the mix of nominees unveiled for Hollywood's Actor Awards, formerly known as the Screen Actors Guild Awards.

item.title: Marble Bar residents share their tips for keeping cool in nationwide heatwave
item.description: From 30 bags of ice in a blow-up pool to misted toilets and getting plenty of sleep, residents in Marble Bar share their top tips to weather a heatwave.

item.title: Community-run heatwave havens offer respite for vulnerable residents

item.title: Ashes 2026: Australia claims 4-1 series win after surviving nervy run chase to win Sydney Test
item.description: Australia chases down 160 with five wickets remaining in Sydney to round out the Ashes in style as Usman Khawaja bids farewell to Test cricket.

item.title: Disability support worker charged with client's manslaughter granted bail

item.title: Algal bloom researcher 'deeply disturbed' by political interference claims, committee told
item.description: An inquiry into South Australia's harmful algal bloom has been rocked by claims from a prominent ecologist, who has raised allegations of government interference in scientific research into the bloom's causes.

item.title: Commercial fishers hit by Kimberley Marine Park left waiting five years for compensation
item.description: Kimberley fishers impacted by the establishment of a marine park say the government has failed to deliver promised compensation.

item.title: Laura Peel boosts Australian Winter Olympics hopes with World Cup aerials victory
item.description: After recently struggling for form, Australian star Laura Peel strikes gold at the aerials World Cup event in Canada in her best showing of the season.

item.title: Man dies in quad bike crash on forestry road in Railton, northern Tasmania
item.description: A 20-year-old man has died after his quad bike crashed on a forestry road in northern Tasmania, with police saying it is the third serious all-terrain vehicle crash in recent weeks.

item.title: Teens survive horror crash after police pursuit of allegedly stolen car in Lithgow
item.description: The teenagers suffered serious leg injuries after the allegedly stolen car crashed into a fence in the early hours of the morning.

item.title: What the seizure of Maduro means for China, Venezuela's biggest oil buyer
item.description: Despite being one of the strongest critics of Donald Trump's move to capture Nicolás Maduro, Beijing has not moved beyond condemnation of Washington.

item.title: Veteran Stan Wawrinka says Nick Kyrgios is an 'amazing player' amid wildcard debate
item.description: Retiring veteran Stan Wawrinka was all class discussing the AO wildcard debate surrounding Nick Kyrgios, putting aside the pair's troubled history.

item.title: Independent film collective Movie Juice launches inaugural summer film fest

item.title: Further murder charges laid over stabbing deaths of Dau Akueng, 15, and Chol Achiek, 12
item.description: Homicide detectives lay further murder charges over the high-profile deaths of 15-year-old Dau Akueng and 12-year-old Chol Achiek in Melbourne's outer suburbs last September.

item.title: Ex-Test cricketer Damien Martyn returns home after waking from induced coma
item.description: Adam Gilchrist says his former Australia teammate Damien Martyn has been released from a Gold Coast hospital.

item.title: Kentbruck Green Energy Hub passes planning hurdle but report highlights environmental concerns
item.description: The Kentbruck Green Energy Hub would include wind turbines up to 270m tall, and be built inside active pine plantations, but its location has worried conservationists.

item.title: Queensland prisoner confesses to killing inmate at Maryborough Correctional Centre
item.description: Isaac James Martin, 31, says he has not "bothered" to get legal representation, telling a Brisbane court he "killed old mate because he's a child molester".

item.description: The deputy governor of the Reserve Bank Andrew Hauser confirms the news mortgage borrowers would not have wanted to hear — interest rates are highly unlikely to head lower anytime soon.

item.description: There is no lounging by the pool for these travellers, who are spending a week swimming the remote waters of the Turkish Lycian coast.

item.title: WA antique shop forced to shut after almost four decades in business as rent spikes

item.description: The Brisbane Lions will not stand in the way of Lachie Neale if the club's former co-captain chooses to return to Perth at the end of the season.

item.title: Minnesota ICE shooting takes life of a legal observer, according to local representatives
item.description: As Donald Trump's immigration crackdown escalates in Minneapolis, networks of local residents patrol the streets too, warning of incoming ICE raids, documenting what happens and offering legal advice to those targeted.

item.title: Nick Reiner's lawyer resigns but says his client is not guilty of murdering parents
item.description: Lawyer Alan Jackson gave no reason for quitting but says that under California law, his client is definitely not guilty of murdering his parents, Rob Reiner and Michele Singer Reiner.

item.title: New research finds keeping room temperature at 24 degrees or below could reduce sleep stress for older Australians
item.description: The study by Griffith University in Brisbane finds that a room temperature while sleeping of more than 24 degrees Celsius increases heart rate variability and physiological stress.
